description: 21.04 I'm sure its awesome -- will try compile it myself

The TLDR fix is to disable the service and manually run:

/snap/spotifyd/current/bin/spotifyd -c ~/.config/spotifyd

I see many one star reviews unjustly blaming spotifyd for "not working". The thing works, the service starts on reboot and all, but there's no way to get the service to access the config file through the expected path of "/root/snap/spotifyd/current/.config/spotifyd/spotifyd.conf" (even if you chmod 777 the thing).

But running the daemon as I explain on the TLDR works just fine.

Snap really drops the ball in properly explaining to both developers and users how the sandboxed system is supposed to work. And many times, even if one follows all snap guidelines, we get access errors, sometimes even with no way to do a workaround.

At least this one time the workaround is pretty easy.

I simply have the following bash script to start/restart spotifyd whenever I want to:

killall spotifyd
/snap/spotifyd/current/bin/spotifyd -c ~/.config/spotifyd
summary: Fix is simple, snap is at fault, not spotifyd
